movieReview: The story of the '88 USSR Olympic Basketball team, much of which went on to form to team of the '92 team for the newly restored Lithuania.  Really great story
Really slow.  Funny at times, an impressive effort, but not a good movie.
Fine.  I know nothing about the real life prison this film is set in, but it was very predictable for 2/3rds of the film.  But the ending kind of redeemed it a bit for me.
Fantastic.  I really, really enjoyed it.
OK...  Both the ridiculous praise of this film and the criticism of it's portrayal of torture are overblown.
A nice romantic comedy.. There were lots of unwell characters in this film, and the actors did well playing them
I definitely still don’t like musicals. Hooper needs to get over his hard-on for extreme close ups and profile. Hugh and Anne owned.
Amazing Tsunami scenes. Naomi Watts was good, Tom Holland was impressive. A bit manipulative in the last 30m.
A great reminder of the phenomenon that Bo Jackson really was...  The 30 for 30 series is great...
Way more disjoint than I remembered... And the completely random ending didn't get stored in my memory at all...  Totally caught me by surprise.
If you're looking for a film with definitive answers, this is not the film.  Very interesting but just a touch frustrating.
Not that good, nowhere as awful as I feared..  Needed serious editing.  Very much a French film.
An ode to one of the great analog recording studios.  Tons of great interviews with musicians of several generations.
Still really enjoyed this one...
Still amazing.
Holds up great, though there were times that the dialogue felt noticiably constructed.  After seeing Django it is clear that QT has gotten better at his job.

Got the "DeSpecialized Editions" fan edit of the original trilogy. Start with the Special Edition Blu-Rays and then remove all the Lucas revisionist shit (while leaving some of the touchups).  Really great (both the edits and the movie).
Moving documentary about the AIDS crisis and the fight to expedite medication approval (and discovery).
Surprising yet somehow unfulfilling. Not bad, but didn’t really do all that much for me
Also "DeSpecialized".  So great.
Also "DeSpecialized".  While no Empire, this movie holds a special place in my heart.
Good, but not as good as the groups previous short, WESTERN SPAGHETTI
Coco hadn't seen this so I saw it again.  Felt a little longer this time around, but I still enjoyed myself.
Weird little steampunk-ish fantasy... Pretty cool.
movieTitle: Death of a Shadow (Dood Van Een Schaduw)

movieReview: The exact opposite of subtle.
Super-precocious child meets complete trainwreck of an uncle.  Works better than it sounds
I feel like I've seen a version of this 3000 times ("coming of age" guh).  But this is a well made version of this story.
Very sweet....
"Raggety Ayn Rand Dolls"
Cute short that did a phenomenal job of mixing hand and computer animation.
Claymation short that shows how awful women can be until a man does something nice.  Or something.
If the story of Adam & Eve wasn't dumb enough already, add in a somehow domesticated dog.
Just when you think the Catholic Church can't get any more awful...
movieTitle: Mea Maxima Culpa: Silence in the House of God

movieReview: Lots of fun, brought back some great memories.
movieTitle: GLOW: The Story of the Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling

movieReview: Somehow I had never seen this movie.  Not Scorcese's best, but pretty good
Completely unnecessary reboot.  How many origin stories do we need?  And the POV shots made me actively angry.
OK, kind of felt a little TOO homage-y, ala Superman Returns....
Still lots of fun, probably my second-favorite Marvel movie behind The Avengers.
Cool little alien movie, wasn't totally satisfied by the end but the ride was good
Well crafted doc on covering the Swedish trial (and appeals) of The Pirate Bay
movieTitle: TPB AFK: The Pirate Bay Away from Keyboard

movieReview: Very depressing film.
Nuff Said.
I really thought a 90 minute doc on Minecraft would drag but it really didn't.  I knew alot of the info in this movie but still enjoyed it.
Like most HBO documentaries, this one was profoundly depressing.  It is amazing how in the bubble and justified Cheney seems to be.
movieTitle: The World According to Dick Cheney

movieReview: You need to A) Be a huge Shining (or Kubrick) nerd and B) ver tolerant of conspiracy/extrapolation theories to enjoy this movie.  But if you meet those criteria you'll get a kick out of it
This was randomly on cable when we turned on the TV and we got sucked into it.  Still lots of fun
I have really mixed feelings about this film.  I swung from disliking it to loving it throughout.  I THINK I liked it???
Very meh.
A really good movie.  Small, well-acted, and clever in a "not in your face" way.
Often Japanese 'fucked up' movies are shocking just for the sake of being shocking.  This one falls into that category, but at least it's funny at the same time. :)
Different from it's predecessors but quite good.
Holy god is this bad.
Still so awesome.
I really liked this movie, but I totally understand why others may not.  I found it riveting.
I learned so much about Steve Jobs and Apple that I had never known.  Mostly because it was all made up.
Meh
Fun, but not as good as Jackass.  The TV show was better.
Exactly what you'd expect..  A straigth ahead biopic that is pretty melodramatic at times.
Lovely. Refreshing to have a film with teens who seem like real people instead of over-the-top nonsense. In the spirit of John Hughes. #IFFBoston
Good but could have been great if it lost about 30m. #iffboston
A gorgeous yet depressing look of addiction.  An interesting dramatic take. #iffboston
A great look at the life and work of Kathleen Hanna.  Really tight and great interviews. #iffboston
ok, but it kinda felt like yet another Watergate doc. The home movie footage wasn’t all that compelling. #IFFBoston
A really fun time. Big thanks to @mr_wheatley for such a fun film. #IFFBoston
a great doc about Richard Williams and his failed 25+ year quest to make his animated masterpiece. #iffboston
a nice take on The Bard. I always have some difficulty with his prose, but it was lots of fun
Looked at all of the undeclared, covert military actions the US is taking all over the world.  Deeply troubling. #iffboston
a drama about how a little lie can spiral into something terrible. Felt a bit manipulated by the end but still good. #iffboston
OK but I think the director was dangerous when it came to protecting identity. #IFFBoston
spent a weekend with RAM in Appalachia.  An good look at an often overlooked failing of our medical system. #IFFBoston
one of the most powerful documentaries I’ve ever seen.  Profoundly disturbing.  #IFFBoston
A good thriller set in the world of eco-anarchists.  I love Marling and Skarsgård and they carried this well.  #IFFBoston
Blah blah blah caricatures of people acting like no people on earth.  Don't watch this movie.
Probably the first found footage movie I’ve liked since BLAIR WITCH.  Bobcat got it done.  #IFFBoston
A fun and funny way to end this year's #IFFBoston.
Possibly better the second time.
Stil just as powerful the second time.  FUMN crowd seemed to agree.
Not quite as awesome as I remembered it, but still pretty funny.
A movie that definitely improves on the second viewing..
Fun, but suffered from not having ANY content from the show itself (save for a few stills) whic hwould have helped provide context.
okay… Slow start, Some of the plot was extra inane & often the ‘suspense’ missed the mark. But it had some dumb fun moments
Generic docu-clip-talking-head thing on grindhouse movies.
Still a good movie, watched again with Coco's parents.
I liked this movie, worked on several levels for me...  Not as much fun as the first one, but still quite good.  Some of the nods to TOS were too much, though
if you’re looking for an incoherent, poorly edited mess of a film that calls itself a doc but documents little, this is for you!
I generally hate biopics, and I wanted to hate this so badly but I couldn't.

I knew that Ricky Jay was a magician and sometimes actor, but that is basically all I knew going in.  While this doc didn't cover much about his personal life at all, it was a pretty good capsule of his career and influences.
movieTitle: Deceptive Practice: The Mysteries and Mentors of Ricky Jay

movieReview: Really great, possibly better the second time.
Not quite as great as I remembered it from childhood, but still not too shabby of a time-travel movie.
Still a really fun film.
Jay is a master with cards, and it is fascinating to watch him work.
Interviews with several crewmembers on The Shining.  Probably only interesting to real Shining degens.
movieTitle: Staircases to Nowhere: Making Stanley Kubrick's 'The Shining' (Extended)

movieReview: Very good documentary covering Richard Pryor's career...

Entertaining movie, threw away all of the camp, I wish it had also thrown out the origin story too but I lost that battle...  But it was pretty good anyway.  I look forward to the next installment now that th origin shit is out of the way.
A pretty decent zombie movie, but definitely not a great one.  Kept me entertained, tho sagged in a few places.  Would have preferred family storyline was completely eliminated
Hadn't seen this since before I had moved to Boston.  Better than I remembered...
Good history of the life and death of Napster, and an amazing reminder of how different things were 10-15 years ago..
Not as bad as people made it out to be, but not all that great either.  Perfectly acceptable cable tv viewing, don't pay for it
A funny, raunchy comedy...  Not great, but amusing enough...
Sharks.  Monsters.  Awesome.
Dumb.
Beautiful film..  Plot is a little nonsense, but I didn't care because it was beautifully shot.  Always love Gosling, and he doesn't disappoint.
A decent cop drama, a little amped up but not your usual Statham action flick.
Still pretty good, held up better than I expected of a childhood favorite
For some reason I had a bad memory of this movie, but it is better than I remembered.
Tries a bit too hard but still pretty funny.  Pretty good for a bunch of actors fucking off.
It doesn't matter that you saw a movie 3 times in as many months when it is this good.
Amazing, as always.
Pretty meh.  About 30m too long and pretty derivative
Gut-wrenching doc by Herzog profiling victims and those responsible for accidents caused by texting while driving.

movieReview: Johnny Mnemonic + Neuromancer with a dash of T2 and Mass Effect.

Such a sad yet inspiring story...
A solid doc about yet another artists taken too early...
Funny, maybe not as much as it's predecessors in the Cornetto Trilogy, but still quite funny.  If you liked their other films you'll like this one.
Anyone who loves music should see this.
Has some typical "Hollywood drama" flaws, but still an enjoyable flilm.
Immediately forgettable but fun anyway.  Not great, but entertaining.  Probably would make a great Netflix or Cable viewing.
Horrible.
Felt like a movie that was trying WAY too hard to hit "arthouse" status.
Still enjoyable, but the more I see of the past two Trek movies the more I want them to take this cast and make an original story
Way too long, stopped caring... With the usual twists and turns of a whodunnit police procedural it felt like the longest episode of Law & Order ever
Amazing.  3D was worth it.
I've been saying for years that football is a doomed sport.  I have a feeling this film (and book) might accelerate this process.
The killings themselves took a back seat to the relationship between the perpetrators of these crimes.  A very interesting way to frame the picture.
Good, not great.  Had some great ideas and was fun to watch. I look forward to JGLs future work
Very happy to see a doc on Ali that didn't focus as much on his boxing as it did his political/religious life.
Amazing.
Not quite enough there there.  Not bad, but needed some more something

movieReview: Not for everyone, but I really enjoyed it.  You should be prepared for a study of a very unlikable character.
Ok...  Kinda long and the action all ran together at parts.
Great performances by Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto..  Really good film.
Actually liked it better the second time...  Some of the directorial decisions seemed to make more sense for some reason.
Fuck Yeah!

Okay, but some really annoying aspects.  Jumping back and forth in time was irritating, and the suit cams pointing at their faces as opposed to what they were looking at was stupid.  Fairly straightforward crisis in space plot...
Perfectly nice little romantic comedy.
It was hard for me to get past some of the psychobabble, but there is something mesmerizing about Zizek
Not great, but funny enough.  Cable viewing imo
When I though it was over, it was only halfway done...
Wow.  I have no idea how this film got made, and I also don't know how it doesn't have more of a cult following.
Meh.  Too long, and by toning down the violence they managed to make things more uncomfortable...  As if kids killing each other was a casual thing.
Better than the first, could have lost some runtime and I went into it completely cold plotwise, so that might have helped.
Awesome as always.  I could watch any of the Jackass material at any time.
Not Good-Bad bad, not Indignant bad, just bad.
If you were looking for a mediocre remake of Die Hard set in the White House, this isn't a bad choice.  Perfectly reasonable dumb fun action movie.
Good doc on the rise and fall of videotape.  Probably longer than it needed to be, but still lots of good information and nostalgia contained within.
A great bio of the master of schlocky horror gimmicks...

movieReview: What an amazing run.

Incredible Story of a man who was wrongly convicted of the murder of his wife, and his exoneration decades later.

movieReview: Another sweet film, nice story and very well paced.
Really, really good...  I would say "Classic Scorcese", but this movie was funny in ways his previous work is not.
Depressing but good.  I've never had any interest in zoos or aquariums and this movie just reinforced that.
Michael Shannon always plays crazy well, but he did a particularly good job of capturing Kuklinski, who I remember from the HBO specials in the 90s.  Lots of surprising people cast in small roles.
Hallelujah Holy Shit
Still a funny little movie...  Plays to Jack Black's strengths well.

Way better than the 1st movie, but still too long.  I guess that happens when you turn a 300 page book into 9 hours of film.  After the first 10 minutes or so the 48fps disappeared for me and I think it actually helped in certain scenes.  Much less distracting this time.  Cliffhanger is pretty bullshit.
movieTitle: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
